Last week, I sent a letter to Vice President Mike Pence, FEMA Administrator Peter Gaynor, and HHS Secretary Alex Azar demanding answers on this.

👍Provide adequate staffing @ the polls
🚗Expand curbside voting to ALL ages

🗳Adopt vote-anywhere rules

It is insane that our nurses are being forced to care for the sick without masks and respirators. The Department of Labor must immediately issue emergency workplace standards to protect our health workers, their families, and their patients. https://twitter.com/CBSNews/status/1246804028601896961 QT @CBSNews In tears, a nurse says she quit her job after she was asked to work in a coronavirus ICU without a face mask: “America is not prepared, and nurses are not being protected” https://www.cbsnews.com/live-updates/coronavirus-pandemic-covid-19-latest-news-2020-04-03/ http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUtpllcWkAMcCOn.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1246205761103020033/pu/vid/320x320/wRI_SVGYvpQVkmYj.mp4?tag=10

RT @TwuSamuelsen #Frontline Transport Workers must be protected. When employers don't meet their obligation to protect us, workers must fightback to defend our health and safety. When workers fightback we win!! #CoronavirusPandemic #PPENow #Covid19 @ATUComm https://twitter.com/transportworker/status/1246873974891597824 QT @transportworker Transport workers are the circulatory system that delivers essential workers to the #frontlines of the war against #Covid19. Helping #SmallBusiness isn’t charity, its a national imperative:

- 99.9% of all U.S. businesses

- employ 59 million people & close to 50% of non-govt jobs

- create 4 out of 10 new jobs

- represent 45% of our nations GDP

We MUST get #PPP to work

https://issuesinsights.com/2020/04/04/small-businesses-are-almost-out-of-time-and-it-matters-to-all-of-us/

During a pandemic, the Trump administration announced they were changing rules that would worsen air and water pollution. It's outrageous.

We should be working to reduce coronavirus risk, not exacerbating underlying conditions. I've called on the EPA to halt these rules.

This is an economic meltdown. Millions of Americans have no food in the pantry to feed their kids. No money for rent. Can't pay their mortgage, student debt, or medical bills.

We cannot say, "Let's wait and see." We need to get help to our people now and protect their wellbeing.

Thank you to all the farmers, growers, farmworkers, supply line workers, grocery store clerks, delivery workers, and anyone who is on the front lines making sure our communities are fed. We’ll continue fighting for you every step of the way.

Yes. https://twitter.com/dbongino/status/1246592407552000000 QT @dbongino We’ll get through this. We’ve survived and prospered through a revolution, a civil war, 2 world wars, multiple pandemics, and more. We’ll get through this.

RT @GovMurphy After multiple conversations with the @WhiteHouse, we’ve secured an additional 500 ventilators. 

Ventilators are our #1 need right now. I won't stop fighting to get us the equipment we need to save every life we can.

Thankful for our nation’s brave nurses who are day in and day out risking their own lives to help save coronavirus patients. We see you and we’re fighting to ensure you have the personal protective equipment needed to safely do your jobs. 
https://www.wsj.com/articles/nurses-are-the-coronavirus-heroes-11585608987

It is incomprehensible that we have governors continuing to do business as usual rather than issue stay-at-home orders.

If they're not able to do it, the federal government should. https://www.nytimes.com/2020/04/03/us/coronavirus-states-without-stay-home.html

Failing to prepare? Yes, fed govt should have done more, but you & Obama ran the executive branch for EIGHT years, you depleted the National Stockpile & didn’t replenish it. And when Trump rightly halted flights from China, you blasted it as “xenophobic.” Stop playing politics. https://twitter.com/joebiden/status/1246524690668998656 QT @JoeBiden Donald Trump is not responsible for the coronavirus, but he is responsible for failing to prepare our nation to respond to it.

Good! But it doesn’t mean the model is “wrong”

What it would mean is we Americans, by complying with expert advice & govt orders and our heroic & brave medical professionals, are outperforming the model

America is undefeated.

And #WeWillWin again! https://twitter.com/brithume/status/1246832419354877952 QT @brithume The closely watched University of Washington model has another bad day. https://twitter.com/alexberenson/status/1246825831864963073

RT @ClintSmithIII Black people are disproportionately dying from this virus & it's impossible to separate from decades of hypersegregation, overcrowded public housing, landfills & air pollution in our neighborhoods, & lack of access to health care. This is structural. It didnt have to be this way.

The increasing loss of life due to #COVID19 in New Jersey and around the country is alarming & heartbreaking. We must slow the spread of the virus and our best tool to #flattenthecurve continues to be practicing social distancing. Please stay home. https://www.nj.com/coronavirus/2020/04/right-now-coronavirus-is-the-most-common-cause-of-death-in-nj.html

Some signs of progress on #PPP. 

A #Florida bank with 4000 #PPPloans applications could only get 20 of its 70 officers onto ETRAN the @SBAgov⁩ portal at 4pm Saturday. 

SBA continues system upgrade & by 8pm all 70 had access.

Even before this pandemic, two-thirds of low-income workers did not have paid sick leave.

Nearly half of Americans were a $400 unexpected expense away from financial hardship.

A one-time check won’t cut it. I’m staying in D.C. fighting for monthly cash payments and paid leave.

Immigrant children don’t belong in detention, especially in the middle of a pandemic when a number of them and staff are showing symptoms of coronavirus. For the safety of these children’s lives, HHS must accelerate their release. https://www.nbcsandiego.com/news/investigations/employees-fear-spread-of-coronavirus-in-san-diegos-migrant-youth-shelters/2297632/
Esta pandemia está ocurriendo en CONTEXTO & muchas de las personas que niegan el racismo no tienen idea de lo que es en realidad.

Incluyo este último detalle para ilustrar que estas son también comunidades Negras HISTÓRICAMENTE, lo cual significa que han sido impactadas por las políticas racistas como las prácticas discriminatorias de redlining por generaciones.

Yo represento unos de los vecindarios más impactados en la nación:  Corona & East Elmhurst.  

Estos son vecindarios abrumadoramente Negros & Latinx.  La casa de Louis Armstrong está aquí.

Para todxs aquellxs que dicen que “no hay evidencia que disparidades raciales con respecto al impacto de COVID existen.” ⬇️⬇️⬇️ https://twitter.com/MarkLevineNYC/status/1246177752098705408 QT @MarkLevineNYC Michigan has just started reporting on coronavirus cases by race.

African Americans are 14% of that state's population but 40% of deaths.

This pandemic is reflecting--and exacerbating--inequality.

NYC should publish this data as well, so we get the picture here. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUtOUIIWAAA0OJ1.png
Si algunas personas piensan que las desigualdades raciales son un mito al igual que otros temas que discuto, entonces ¿porqué se ponen muchos más violentxs y enojadxs sobre este tema?

Lideo con muchas amenazas violentas, fuertes críticas, etc.

Pero nunca recibo más odio apuntado hacia mí que cuando abordo las desigualdades raciales.
